p: On days 21 and 44, one broiler per replicate (weight close to the average of the pen) was selected, weighed and humanely killed by cervical dislocation. Small intestine and caeca lengths were obtained with a measuring tape on a wet cloth surface to avoid shrinkage. After cleaning the organs of residual tissues, the empty weight of crop, proventriculus, gizzard, small intestine and caeca were determined. Liver, spleen and pancreas weights were also recorded.
